content.question:
A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity v at any time t, for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, is given by v(t) = e2 sin t - 1. At time t = 0, the particle is at the origin.

(a) On the axes provided, sketch the graph of v(t) for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>16</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity v at any time t, for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, is given by v(t) = e2 sin t - 1. At time t = 0, the particle is at the origin.

(a) On the axes provided, sketch the graph of v(t) for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>16</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
(b) During what intervals of time is the particle moving to the left? Give a reason for your answer.
(c) Find the total distance traveled by the particle from t = 0 to t = 4.

(d)  Is there any time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>16</mn> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> </math> at which the particle returns to the origin? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
